Reviews.Title: Watch out for the poor QC issue
Reviews.Author: Y. Wang
Reviews.Content: The spec of this phone looks good among all of the budget phone, and that is the reason I purchased it last Saturday. Unfortunately, my phone arrived with a faulted proximity sensor that every time when I make a phone call, the screen will directly go black until the end of the call. After did some searches on the internet, I figured out my situation was not a single case. There are some discussions about the proximity sensor issue across nearly entire Huawei's products line, including the G330, G510 and other phones. So, if you are interested on this phone, be careful for their poor QC, and carefully check your phone when it arrive.In addition of the QC issue, Huawei tried to build their own UI instead of the standard Android interface. Again, unfortunately, their-own interface is not that user friendly, and does not give many plus to this phone...The only reason that I will give this phone two stars, instead of just one, is the camera on the back. Its hard to find a phone with this price range come with the LED flash. Although the camera is only 5M pixels, the additional flash really helps to increase the usage of this phone, makes it easy to use indoor.

Reviews.Title: A very good value phone
Reviews.Author: T. C. lam
Reviews.Content: There is a new version of $800 iEgo phone you can buy every year or this one for $150 for average use.  The only 2 things I can complain are the low 512RAM and no 4G support, but they are stated in the product description already.  Therefore, they are not some hidden surprises.  Other than that, the screen, size, and everything else are above average for the price.

Reviews.Author: Esilda C.

If had know the real product, I wouldn't have spent a penny on this big pile of garbage! Don't buy this.Para los que no entienden inglés: Esto es publicidad engañosa! El celular no es el mismo que se detalla en la información. Me llego ayer y de verdad es un fiasco. El teléfono ni siquiera tiene flash. Es una versión económica del verdadero teléfono. No lo recomiendo bajo ningún concepto.

Reviews.Title: Good budget phone
Reviews.Author: Chibi
Reviews.Content: So, first, I already knew that the phone I was buying was the 3g version without flash so there are no complaints about that. I was fine without the flash, though it would have been nice if there was flash. The phone is really cheap for about $120 and a decent sized screen. Of course, as an Android, the phone has a really bad battery. If I just leave my phone uncharged overnight and check it the next morning, about 10% will be gone--doing nothing! The phone is quite laggy due to Huawei's system on top of Android and the browser's search will always stay Chinese. Overall, it's a decent phone, but if you're going to use your phone all the time, invest in a better one.

Reviews.Title: misleading
Reviews.Author: dana
Reviews.Content: it's a shame that they charged a 20% restock fee for a product that wasn't what they advertised to be! yes it was the phone they said it was, the model anyway! but not the product I thought I was buying, I was looking for a phone for the visully impared which wasthe phone I purchased but without the software, "BIG DIFFERENCE" it's the software that makes the phone different from ordinary phones, well I'm not happy to be deducted 20% restock fee which is over 42 dollars plus 12 dollars and change to ship it back. I think i'll stick to shopping in stores thanks
